com.ansca.corona

Class CoronaLua

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ansca.corona.CoronaLua

  • public class CoronaLua
extends Object
    Provides a set of convenience functions for use with the LuaState.

    You should call these methods inside a CoronaRuntimeTask to ensure that modifications to the LuaState happen on the Corona thread.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int NOREF
      Used to mark a references as invalid.
      static int REFNIL
      Returned when LuaState.ref(int) is called on a nil value.

    • Method Detail

      • normalize

        public static int normalize(LuaState L,
            int index)
        Returns an absolute index location on the Lua stack for the passed index. This is useful if you have negative stack indices, as these are relative to the top of the stack.
        Parameters:
        L - The LuaState to operate on.
        index - The index on the lua stack that we want a normalized value for.
        Returns:
        An absolute index location on the Lua stack for the passed index.

      • newRef

        public static int newRef(LuaState L,
         int index)
        Creates a Java-side reference to a Lua object on the Lua stack at index. You can use this to store and access Lua objects from native Java code. Typically you use this when you want to store a reference to a Lua listener.
        Parameters:
        L - The LuaState to operate on.
        index - The index on the lua stack holding the object we want a Java-side reference for.
        Returns:
        Returns a reference identifier.

      • deleteRef

        public static void deleteRef(LuaState L,
             int ref)
        Release the Java-side reference to a Lua value, which would otherwise prevent the Lua value from being garbage collected.
        Parameters:
        L - The LuaState to operate on.
        ref - The Java-side reference to release.

      • newEvent

        public static void newEvent(LuaState L,
            String eventName)
        Creates a Corona event with the name property set to eventName.

        This function pushes the created event table to the top of the Lua stack!

        Parameters:
        L - The LuaState to operate on.
        eventName - The name to assign to this Corona event.

      • dispatchEvent

        public static void dispatchEvent(LuaState L,
                 int listenerRef,
                 int nresults)
                          throws Exception
        Dispatches an event by invoking the listener corresponding to listenerRef passing the value at the top of the stack as the Corona event table. You should use newEvent() to create this event.

        This function pops the value from the top of the Lua stack!

        Parameters:
        L - The LuaState to operate on.
        listenerRef - A reference identifier returned by CoronaLua.newRef().
        nresults - The number of results to be dispatched to the event.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • isListener

        public static boolean isListener(LuaState L,
                 int index,
                 String eventName)
        Returns whether the function at index is a Corona listener.
        Parameters:
        L - The LuaState to operate on.
        index - The index on the lua stack holding the function in question.
        eventName - The name of the function at index.

      • toValue

        public static Object toValue(LuaState L,
             int index)
        Returns an Object for the item at the specified index. Supports Lua Strings, Numbers, Booleans, and Tables.

        Added in daily build 2014.2125.

        Parameters:
        L - The LuaState where the object is located.
        index - The index on the lua stack where the object is located.
        Returns:
        An Object with the value of the lua object at the designated index on the lua stack.

      • toHashtable

        public static Hashtable<Object,Object> toHashtable(LuaState L,
                                   int index)
        Creates a Hashtable from a lua table at the specified index on the lua stack.

        Added in daily build 2014.2125.

        Parameters:
        L - The LuaState where the table is located.
        index - The index on the lua stack where the lua table is located.
        Returns:
        A Hashtable with the values of the lua table.

      • pushValue

        public static void pushValue(LuaState L,
             Object object)
        Pushes the Object onto the top of the lua stack. Supports String, Integer, Double, Boolean, and Hashtable objects.

        This function pushes the desired object to the top of the Lua stack!

        Added in daily build 2014.2125.

        Parameters:
        L - The LuaState to operate on.
        object - The Object to be pushed onto the top of the lua stack.

      • pushHashtable

        public static void pushHashtable(LuaState L,
                 Hashtable<Object,Object> hashtable)
        Pushes a lua table with the values in the Hashtable onto the top of the lua stack.

        This function pushes a lua table to the top of the Lua stack!

        Added in daily build 2014.2125.

        Parameters:
        L - The LuaState where the table should be pushed to.
        hashtable - The Hashtable which contains the values to be pushed onto the lua stack as a lua table.

      • dispatchRuntimeEvent

        public static void dispatchRuntimeEvent(LuaState L,
                        int nResults)
        Dispatches the event at the top of the lua stack to the global Runtime object.

        Added in daily build 2014.2125.

        Parameters:
        L - The LuaState of the Runtime object.
        nResults - The number of results returned from the Lua side.
